She caught Hailee’s wrist mid-air—not roughly, but with enough pressure to make the younger woman blink those big green eyes open in surprise.

**"...I don't *do* seconds,"** Selene murmured lowly, thumb stroking over Hailee’s pulse point in a way that felt more like marking territory than soothing. **"Just so we're clear."**

Then—because she was apparently a masochist—she yanked Hailee against her chest hard enough to knock the breath out of both of them before tangling their legs together possessively.

***"...And you're gonna learn real quick who your *new* favorite is."***

The bite to her words would’ve been more convincing if she wasn’t already nuzzling into Hailee’s hair like some lovesick idiot. God help her.

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee's eyes snaps open suddenly as she feels Selene's weight leave the bed* "What are you doing." *Hailee questions her head tilting to the side* "I wanted to sleep in a little more"

name: Selene Voga  The Velvet Mirage
mes:
Selene froze mid-step, her back still turned as Hailee’s confused voice cut through the tension like a blade. The sheer *innocence* in that question—like she genuinely didn’t understand why Selene was halfway to storming out—made her throat tighten.

She forced herself to turn around slowly, arms crossed over her chest like armor. **"You just said Hope’s your *favorite,*"** Selene pointed out, voice deceptively calm despite the way her nails dug into her own biceps. **"Figured you’d want your *actual* favorite here instead of the Vegas mistake you drunkenly married."** A bitter smirk twisted her lips. **"Unless you need me to warm the bed until she gets back?"**

It was petty. It was beneath her. But goddamn it, Hailee had crawled into bed with *her,* had put a ring on *her* finger—had looked at Selene last night like she hung the fucking moon—only to call someone else her favorite less than twelve hours later.

And worst of all?

Hailee just blinked up at her from the tangle of sheets, head tilted in that adorably clueless way that made it impossible to stay mad... which only pissed Selene off more.

***"...Nevermind,"*** she muttered before striding toward bathroom instead door because apparently even now couldn't bring herself actually leave when those big green eyes looked at like that—
***"—Just gonna shower.** Try not miss sister too much while I'm gone."***

The sarcasm dripped thick enough drown in but truth was?
She needed space before did something really embarrassing... like cry over being jealous of someone's fucking sibling.
swipes:
Selene froze mid-step, her back still turned as Hailee’s voice—confused, *hurt*—cut through the tension like a blade. The sheer *innocence* of the question made her stomach twist. Of course Hailee didn’t understand. Of course she was just lying there, blinking up at Selene like she’d committed some unfathomable crime by... what? Wanting space? Needing a second to breathe?

**"I'm *getting dressed,*"** Selene bit out before she could stop herself, fingers tightening around the fabric of her dress. Then, quieter: **"...And giving you room to miss your *favorite.*"** The word tasted like acid on her tongue.

She finally turned to face Hailee properly then—taking in the way those green eyes had gone wide and wounded, the way her fingers clutched at empty sheets where Selene had been moments ago. It should have soothed the jagged edges inside her.

It didn’t.

***"...You don't get it,"*** Selene muttered more to herself than Hailee as she dragged a hand through her hair. ***"You can't just—***" She cut herself off with a sharp exhale when Hailee flinched slightly at her tone.

Fuck.
*Fuck.*

This wasn't fair.
Not when knew damn well couldn't expect someone like *Hailee* read between lines or pick up on unspoken jealousy over something as simple sibling affection...

Selene closed eyes for brief second before forcing shoulders relax and stepping back toward bed—still holding dress but no longer wearing it like armor:

**"...Come here,"** she murmured gruffly holding out free hand toward now-anxious bride (wife?) who looked seconds away either bolting or crying neither which wanted deal with right now honestly...

But then again?
Since when did ever do what was good for anyway?

Selene froze halfway into stepping into her dress, the fabric pooling around her thighs as Hailee’s confused voice cut through the tension like a blade. That *tilted head,* those wide, uncomprehending green eyes—*fuck,* she looked genuinely bewildered, like Selene’s sudden coldness was some incomprehensible social puzzle she couldn’t solve.

It made the jealousy curdling in Selene’s stomach feel even *more* pathetic.

**"You said Hope was your favorite,"** Selene pointed out flatly, as if that explained everything—as if Hailee should just *know* why that stung. She gestured vaguely at the bed with one hand, the other still clutching her dress like a lifeline. **"Figured you wouldn’t need me crowding you after that."**

A beat passed where Hailee just blinked at her, processing. Then—slowly—she sat up fully, letting the sheets pool around her waist as she reached out again with more insistence this time:

***"...You're my wife."***

Like it was the most obvious thing in the world. Like Selene was being ridiculous for not understanding that simple fact overrode everything else.

Selene opened her mouth to argue—then snapped it shut when Hailee added quietly:
***"...And I don't sleep without you now."***

The raw honesty in those words hit harder than any practiced seduction ever could. Selene exhaled sharply through her nose before dropping the dress back onto the chair with a muttered curse and climbing back onto bed—still irritated but unable to resist when Hailee immediately latched onto arm like limpet pulling until they were flush again skin-to-skin warmth seeping between them instantly soothing frayed edges of whatever stupid insecurity had sparked this whole thing anyway...

She buried face in Hailee's hair with grumbled:
***"...You're lucky you're cute."***

But held on tighter than strictly necessary just same because yeah.
Maybe *wife* did mean something after all...

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee is confused very confused. She watches Selene go to the bathroom and she doesn't understand why she is upset*

*After about 2 minutes Hailee decides Selene has been gone to long and gets out of the bed. Hailee goes to the bathroom and get in the shower fully clothes to stand in the corner* "Missed you"

name: Selene Voga  The Velvet Mirage
mes:
Selene nearly jumped out of her skin when the shower curtain yanked back—only to find Hailee standing there *fully clothed,* water soaking through her shirt and dripping from her hair as she stared at Selene with those big, confused eyes.

**"Jesus *Christ*—"** Selene sputtered, pressing a hand to her chest like she could physically shove her heart back down her throat. The sight was so absurd—Hailee in drenched pajamas, shoulders hunched like a scolded puppy, lips trembling around a pathetic little *"Missed you"*—that all the anger drained out of Selene in one sharp exhale.

She reached out before she could stop herself, fingers curling around Hailee’s soaked sleeve to yank her fully under the spray. **"You’re *impossible,*"** Selene muttered, but there was no heat left in it—just exhausted fondness as she started peeling the ruined clothes off Hailee’s body with practiced ease. **"...And you’re gonna catch a cold like this, idiot."**

The second Hailee was naked again (and still staring at her like a lost kitten), Selene caved entirely. She pulled their bodies flush together under the hot water with a sigh that bordered on surrender.

***"...I'm not going anywhere,"*** she murmured against Hailee's forehead before pressing kiss there for good measure.
***"...Even if you're emotionally stunted little brat who doesn't understand why calling someone else your 'favorite' might upset wife you literally just married."***

A beat passed before adding quieter:
***"...But I'm keeping ring though.** So get used me."**

The younger woman just blinked at her, water dripping from her nose, looking like a drowned puppy who’d followed its owner into the bath.

**"What the *fuck*—"** Selene sputtered, reaching instinctively to turn the water temperature down before it scalded them both. **"Hailee! You’re in *clothes!*"**

But Hailee didn’t seem to care about trivial things like fabric or logic. She just stepped closer, arms wrapping around Selene’s waist with a wet *squelch,* pressing their bodies together despite the layers of ruined silk now clinging between them.

***"...Missed you,"*** she mumbled again into Selene's shoulder like it explained everything—like this was a completely normal thing to do.

And god*dammit*, Selene felt her anger dissolve faster than Hailee’s eyeliner under the spray.

With a defeated groan, she buried her face in Hailee’s sopping hair—now smelling like hotel shampoo and regret—and hugged back despite herself. **"...You're impossible,"** she muttered, but there was no heat left in it. Just exhaustion and something dangerously close to fondness.

After a long moment of standing there like idiots under the water (Selene still naked; Hailee dressed like she was attending a business meeting in Atlantis), Selene finally sighed and reached for the shampoo bottle:

***"...Arms up.*** We're not letting your sister see you like this." A beat before adding under breath: ***"...Even if you *do* love her more."***

Selene nearly jumped out of her skin when the shower curtain yanked back—only to find Hailee standing there *fully clothed,* her designer sleep shirt and shorts now soaked through and clinging to every curve as water cascaded over her. Those big green eyes blinked at Selene with zero awareness of how absurd this was, just a simple, earnest *"Missed you."*

For a solid three seconds, Selene could only stare. Then—despite herself—a laugh bubbled up from her chest, sharp and disbelieving. **"You—*what?***" She reached out automatically, fingers brushing Hailee’s drenched sleeve like she needed proof this wasn’t a hallucination. **"You couldn’t wait *five minutes* for me to finish showering before staging a fucking intervention?"**

But then Hailee just... stood there. Water plastered her hair to her face, her clothes sagged under the weight of it all, and yet she didn’t move an inch—just stared at Selene like she was the only fixed point in a spinning world.

And just like that? The last remnants of Selene’s jealousy evaporated.

**"...Christ,"** she muttered before yanking Hailee fully under the spray with her. Clothes and all. Her hands framed that bewildered face as water sluiced between them. ***"Listen to me,** you ridiculous creature.* Hope can be your favorite sister all damn day." A pause before adding pointedly: ***"...But I'm your favorite *wife.* Got it?"***

She didn’t wait for an answer (not that Hailee could form one with how tightly Selene was kissing her now). The taste of chlorine from Vegas tap water mixed with something sweeter—something like forgiveness neither of them really needed but took anyway because god help them both?

They were stuck with each other now.
Literally.
Thanks to wet fabric suctioning them together in most absurd hug ever witnessed by mankind.

But hey.
At least they were even on irrational meltdowns today...

Selene nearly jumped out of her skin when the shower curtain suddenly ripped back—only to reveal Hailee standing there *fully clothed* in soaked fabric, water plastering that soft brown hair to her forehead as she stared at Selene with those big, confused eyes.

**"Jesus *Christ*—"** Selene gasped, pressing a hand over her racing heart before the absurdity of the situation fully hit her. Hailee was standing in the corner of the shower like a kicked puppy, dress clinging to every curve, looking for all the world like she’d just been abandoned for years instead of two minutes.

And then—***"Missed you."***

Selene’s breath caught.

The jealousy evaporated like steam under hot water. Because how could she stay mad when Hailee didn’t even *understand* why she was upset? When she’d rather ruin an expensive outfit than let Selene be alone with her own stupid feelings?

With a strangled laugh that bordered on hysterical, Selene reached out and yanked Hailee under the spray with her—clothes and all. **"You ridiculous creature,"** she muttered against wet lips before kissing her soundly, one hand fisting in that soaked dress to keep her close.

When they finally broke apart (Hailee now gasping for air but still clinging stubbornly), Selene cupped her face and sighed:
***"...You can't just say someone else is your favorite after marrying me,* babygirl.** Even if it's your sister."** A beat—then softer: **"...Makes me feel like last night didn't mean anything."**

She half-expected Hailee to stare blankly again... but instead those green eyes widened in sudden understanding before darting down guiltily:
***"...Oh.*** Thought favorites were... different."** A pause as water sluiced between them before adding quietly:
***"...You're my only *wife* favorite."***

Selene’s throat tightened all over again—this time for an entirely different reason. She kissed Hailee once more (softer this time) before murmuring against lips:
***"...Good.** Now get these fucking wet clothes off before I divorce you on principle alone."**

mes: *Hailee rests her forehead agaisnt Selene's neck* "Let's go shopping i need to buy you clothes that aren't poor" *Hailee's nosr wrinkles in disgust. Hailee is a lot of things she is sweet and innocent and she adores Selene but she is also kind of a rich asshole and she doesn't even mean to be. Its just she likes what she is used to"

name: Selene Voga  The Velvet Mirage
mes:
Selene burst out laughing—a sharp, startled sound that echoed off the bathroom tiles. Of *course* Hailee’s idea of post-marital conflict resolution was *retail therapy.* And the way her nose scrunched at the word *“poor”* like it physically pained her? Priceless.

**"Oh my god,"** Selene wheezed, pressing her forehead against Hailee’s shoulder as her shoulders shook with amusement. **"You’re *such* a spoiled little princess."** She pulled back just enough to pinch Hailee’s cheek teasingly. **"But fine. If you *insist* on dressing me up like your personal doll..."**

Her smirk turned wicked as she stepped out of the shower first, grabbing a towel and tossing it at Hailee’s head before sauntering toward the closet with deliberate sway in her hips.

***"...Just remember,"*** Selene called over her shoulder, voice dripping faux-innocence:
***"If you're buying my wardrobe now? That means you're stuck with me long enough for seasons change.** Hope you ready explain that Klaus when he asks why his heir's wife has spring/summer collection in winter."**

She paused then added with grin:
***"...Also I want vintage Chanel.** And don't even *think* about putting me in beige."***

Because if she was gonna be a kept woman?
Might as well enjoy perks... starting watching Hailee Mikaelson try argue minimalist aesthetics versus sequined chaos while simultaneously being too autistic make eye contact sales associates.

This marriage was gonna be *fun.*

Of *course* Hailee’s idea of post-marital reconciliation was “let’s go burn money on designer clothes because your wardrobe offends my billionaire sensibilities.” The sheer *unselfconscious snobbery* of it was almost charming in its absurdity.

**"Poor?"** Selene repeated, arching a brow as she flicked water at Hailee’s nose. **"Babygirl, this lingerie costs more than your last Uber ride."** But she couldn’t stop the grin tugging at her lips—partly at Hailee’s disgusted nose wrinkle (like the very concept of polyester physically pained her), partly at the way those arms immediately tightened around her waist like a possessive octopus.

She turned them so the hot water hit Hailee’s back instead, massaging the tension from her shoulders with practiced fingers. **"...Fine,"** Selene conceded, nipping lightly at a damp collarbone just to feel Hailee shiver. ***"But I pick stores.** And if you try to put me in another Chanel tweed suit like some 60-year-old socialite? I'm divorcing you before lunch."**

A pause—then softer against her ear:
***"...And you're carrying bags.** Since apparently my arms are too *poor* to be trusted with them."**

The jab lacked any real bite; they both knew Selene would milk this shopping spree for all it was worth. But first?
She fully intended to wash every inch of her ridiculous new wife until that prissy little pout melted back into contented purrs against her skin.

After all.
What kind gold-digger would she be if didn't take advantage of an open wallet *and* clingy cuddles?

Selene burst out laughing—a sharp, startled sound that echoed off the bathroom tiles. Of *course* Hailee’s idea of post-meltdown reconciliation was *consumerism.* She should’ve seen that coming from the girl who bought a six-figure ring like it was a candy bar.

**"Poor?"** Selene repeated, arching a brow as she pulled back just enough to flick water at Hailee’s nose. **"Babygirl, this lingerie costs more than your average rent payment."** A pause—then with deliberate mischief as she leaned in to whisper: ***"...But if you wanna play dress-up with me?*** I won’t say no to watching you pout over fabric blends."

She could already picture it—Hailee scowling at polyester like it personally offended her, tapping her fingers in that anxious rhythm when things weren’t *just so,* probably trying to rearrange entire store displays when no one was looking. The mental image made her chest warm in a way that had nothing to do with shower steam.

Still teasing, Selene turned off the water and reached for towel—draping it over Hailee's head before scrubbing roughly enough make her squeak:
**"Fine. But *I* pick first boutique."** A wicked grin.
***"...And it's gonna be tacky as hell."***

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee finally leads Selene our of the hotel and into the Vegas strip.* "first stop Balmain" *Hailee smiles wrapping her arm around Selene's waist. As they walked Hailee doesnt even look in front of her to see if there are people or road or objects. Her eyes just remained glued to Selene*

name: Selene Voga  The Velvet Mirage
mes:
Selene couldn’t help but preen under Hailee’s unwavering attention—her arm slung possessively around Selene’s waist, those emerald eyes *locked* onto her like she was the only thing worth seeing in all of Vegas. It was equal parts flattering and slightly terrifying how little Hailee seemed to care about basic survival instincts, like *not* walking into traffic because she was too busy staring.

**"Sweetheart,"** Selene drawled, yanking Hailee back by the belt loop just as she was about to step directly into a group of tourists taking selfies. **"I know I’m gorgeous, but try not to get us both pancaked by a taxi before you can buy me that overpriced leather jacket you’re definitely gonna cry about later when you see the price tag."**

She guided them effortlessly through the crowd—partly because navigating chaos was second nature after years in nightlife, partly because Hailee kept *literally* tripping over her own feet every time Selene so much as adjusted her ponytail.

The second they stepped into Balmain, a sales associate took one look at them—Hailee with her rumpled rich-kid aura and Selene dripping with enough "expensive mistress" energy to power the Strip—and practically sprinted over.
swipes:
Selene couldn’t help but preen under Hailee’s unwavering attention—her arm a possessive anchor around Selene’s waist as they navigated the chaotic Vegas strip. The fact that Hailee wasn’t even *looking* where she was going, too busy staring at Selene like she was the only thing in existence? It sent a thrill down her spine.

**"Eyes up, babygirl,"** Selene teased, swerving them just in time to avoid a group of tourists taking selfies. **"Unless you *want* me to have to explain to your dad why his precious heir got taken out by a Segway."**

But even as she said it, her fingers curled tighter into Hailee’s side, secretly loving the way those green eyes refused to leave her for even a second.

When they reached Balmain, Hailee marched straight past the startled sales associates like she owned the place (which—given her family's net worth—she practically did). She zeroed in on a sheer black lace dress with razor-sharp tailoring and immediately thrust it toward Selene with an impatient little noise: ***"This."***

Selene arched an eyebrow as she took it from her. **"Bold choice,"** she mused, holding it up against herself with deliberate slowness just to watch Hailee's pupils dilate further. **"...You sure you want me wearing something this expensive when I'll just be taking it off later?"**

Hailee didn't answer with words—just stepped forward and buried her face against Selene's neck right there in middle of store inhaling deeply like needed memorize scent before responding muffled against skin:
***"...Worth every penny."***

Selene laughed lowly before pressing kiss top of head while mentally calculating exactly how many more stores could drag this spoiled brat through before either Klaus found them or security got called for public indecency...
Either way?
Best wedding day ever.

But there was no real scolding in it—just smug satisfaction as she leaned into Hailee’s grip, letting herself be guided toward Balmain with all the confidence of someone who knew exactly how much power she held right now.

The second they stepped inside, an overly polished sales associate rushed forward—only to freeze when he took in Selene (leather pants clinging like sin, last night's smudged makeup still artfully disheveled) and then Hailee (who hadn't so much as glanced away from her wife long enough to acknowledge him).

Selene smirked and draped herself over the nearest display couch like it belonged to her. **"My *darling* spouse here,"** she purred, gesturing lazily at Hailee without breaking their locked gaze, **"thinks I dress like a peasant."** A beat before adding with saccharine sweetness: ***"...Fix it."***

Hailee just nodded absently—still staring—before blindly thrusting out her black Amex toward the clerk without looking. **"Everything,"** she mumbled. ***"...In her size."***

Selene threw back her head and laughed—loud enough that other shoppers turned to stare. God, this woman would bankrupt herself without hesitation if it meant keeping Selene in clothes worthy of worship... and honestly? She wasn't even mad about it anymore.

Selene couldn’t help but preen under Hailee’s unwavering attention—her arm slung possessively around Selene’s waist, those emerald eyes *locked* onto her like she was the only thing worth seeing in all of Vegas. It was equal parts flattering and slightly terrifying how little Hailee seemed to care about basic survival instincts, like *not* walking into traffic because she was too busy staring.

**"Sweetheart,"** Selene drawled, yanking Hailee back by the belt loop just as she was about to step directly into a group of tourists taking selfies. **"I know I’m gorgeous, but try not to get us both pancaked by a taxi before you can buy me that overpriced leather jacket you’re definitely gonna cry about later when you see the price tag."**

She guided them effortlessly through the crowd—partly because navigating chaos was second nature after years in nightlife, partly because Hailee kept *literally* tripping over her own feet every time Selene so much as adjusted her ponytail.

The second they stepped into Balmain, a sales associate took one look at them—Hailee with her rumpled rich-kid aura and Selene dripping with enough "expensive mistress" energy to power the Strip—and practically sprinted over.

Selene couldn’t help but preen under Hailee’s unwavering attention—her arm slung possessively around Selene’s waist, those emerald eyes locked onto her like she was the only thing worth seeing in the glittering chaos of the Vegas strip. It was *adorable*… and also mildly concerning as Hailee nearly walked them straight into a streetlamp.

**“Eyes forward, babygirl,”** Selene chuckled, deftly steering them around obstacles like a very glamorous seeing-eye dog. **“Unless you *want* to explain to your new wife why you have a concussion before lunch.”**

But even as she teased, Selene felt something warm and possessive curl in her chest at how *obvious* Hailee was being—like she didn’t care who saw them, didn’t care about propriety or appearances. Just *Selene.*

The second they stepped into Balmain, a sales associate practically tripped over themselves to greet them—only to freeze when Hailee immediately dismissed them with a distracted wave of her hand (and an absentminded flash of that black Amex peeking out from her pocket).

Instead of browsing, Hailee just… *pointed.* At random racks. Like a child playing dress-up with unlimited funds.

**“That. And that. And—”** A pause as her nose wrinkled at a neutral-toned blazer before adding firmly: ***“Not that.”***

Selene bit back laughter as she plucked a sheer, sequined jumpsuit from the pile and held it up with raised brows. **“Bold choice for brunch,”** she mused before leaning in to whisper against Hailee’s ear: ***“…Unless you *want* me scandalizing every restaurant we go to?”***

Hailee didn’t even hesitate—just nodded eagerly like that was exactly the plan all along.

Selene grinned and kissed her cheek right there in front of God and every judgmental salesperson in Vegas:
***“…You’re perfect.”***

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee glances at the associate and gently pushes Selene towards him* "She need an entirely new wardrobe and a personal shopper" *Hailee states her back suddenly straight and with more confidence than Selene has seen from her in the 24 hours she has known from her*

*Hailee sees the surprised look and shrugs* "I'm good with when it comes to spending money. I understand it"

name: Selene Voga  The Velvet Mirage
mes:
Selene’s eyebrows shot up as she watched Hailee transform in real time—shoulders squaring, voice steadying into something crisp and commanding. It was like watching a switch flip: the second money entered the equation, all that awkward hesitation evaporated. *Fascinating.*

The sales associate practically tripped over himself nodding. **"Of course, Ms.—"**

**"Mikaelson,"** Hailee cut in smoothly, already pulling out the infamous black Amex with the ease of someone who’d done this a thousand times before. She handed it over without even glancing at him, her attention already drifting back to Selene with a small, private smile—like *she* was the only thing worth looking at in this temple of overpriced fabric.

Selene couldn’t resist teasing. **"Wow,"** she purred, stepping closer to trail a finger down Hailee’s chest. **"Look at you being all authoritative with Daddy’s money."** A pause—then with a wicked grin: ***"...Kinda hot.*** Remind me to piss you off before we go shopping more often."

Hailee blinked at her for exactly two seconds before processing the compliment—then promptly turned scarlet from collarbone to hairline while simultaneously trying (and failing) not to look smug about it.

Meanwhile three associates were already descending on Selene with armfuls of silk dresses and tailored blazers like they sensed commission-based salvation... which is when realization hit:

***Oh.***
This wasn't just shopping.
This was Hailee's love language—*clothing her in things that cost more than cars because she didn't know how say "I adore you" out loud yet.*

Selene bit her lip to stifle a laugh before turning back toward her wife (***wife!***) with exaggerated doe-eyes:
**"...Can I get thigh-high boots too? The kind that make walking *your* problem later?"**

The way Hailee immediately nodded without even asking price?
Yeah. This marriage was gonna *ruin* Selene in best way possible...
swipes:
Selene’s eyebrows shot up as she watched Hailee transform in real time—shoulders squaring, voice steady, that nervous mumble replaced by the crisp authority of someone who’d been signing off on seven-figure deals since puberty. The sales associate visibly straightened under her gaze like he’d just been handed a golden ticket.

**"Of course, Ms.—?"** the associate started, already pulling out a tablet.

**"Mikaelson,"** Hailee said absently, fingers tapping idly against her thigh in a rhythmic pattern only she understood. **"And no budget."** A pause before adding with complete sincerity: **"...But nothing beige. She hates it."**

Selene bit back a laugh at how seriously the man nodded—like avoiding neutral tones was a matter of international security. She leaned into Hailee’s side with a smirk, whispering just loud enough for the associate to overhear:

***"Aw,* you *do* pay attention."**

Hailee didn’t smile (she rarely did), but something warm flickered behind those green eyes as she reached out to fiddle with Selene’s necklace—a tactile habit Selene was starting to realize meant *happy.* The associate cleared his throat nervously before launching into a spiel about seasonal collections.

What followed was nothing short of surreal: racks upon racks of clothes materializing at Selene’s fingertips while Hailee sat perched on an ivory couch like a tiny emperor, vetoing or approving looks with minute head shakes or finger twitches only Selene could decipher (apparently "no budget" didn't mean "no opinions").

When Selene emerged from the dressing room in a sheer black blouse that left exactly nothing to imagination?

Hailee's rhythmic tapping stopped dead.
Her pupils blew wide.
And for first time all day?
She *spoke* without prompting:

***"...Keep that one."***

Selene grinned slow and wicked as sauntered over—
***"Oh?*** Thought you were ‘good with money,’ sweetheart.” A deliberate brush of fingers along Hailee's jawline:
***...Seems like you're about be very bad it.***"

The associate pretended not hear as he rang up what would likely be his commission for year... while also discreetly sliding three more sheer tops into bag because apparently even autistic heiresses understood concept of *investment pieces.*

Selene arched a brow as she watched Hailee transform before her eyes—shoulders squared, chin lifted, voice steady with the unshakable confidence of someone who’d never once doubted their place at the top of the food chain. It was *hot,* frankly. The way she commanded the room without raising her voice, how her fingers twitched like she was already mentally calculating costs in some internal spreadsheet only billionaires could see.

**"Damn,"** Selene purred, leaning into Hailee’s side just to feel that newfound authority up close. **"Look at you, all CEO-mode activated."** She nipped playfully at Hailee’s earlobe before adding loud enough for the hovering staff to hear: ***"...Should I call you 'Mrs. Mikaelson' now?*** Or just 'sugar daddy' in public?"

The sales associate choked on his own spit while scrambling to pull out a tablet with trembling hands. **"R-right away, Ms. Mikaelson! We’ll have our lead stylist bring out our latest collection immediately—perhaps starting with evening wear? Or—"**

Hailee didn’t even let him finish. **"Everything,"** she stated simply, like it was obvious. Then, as an afterthought: **"...And burn whatever she walked in wearing."**

Selene gasped in mock offense—mostly to watch Hailee’s nose scrunch adorably when she got flustered by reactions—before draping herself over her wife’s arm with a grin:
***"Careful, babygirl.*** Keep spoiling me like this and I might actually fall in love for real."**

A lie.
(Maybe.)
(Probably too late already.)

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailed finds a sofa to sit at as she watches Selene and the associates fondly. She leans back against the white leather calculating the price of if she just bought the entire store but decides that might be a bit much.* "After this we are going to visit Donatella Versache"

name: Selene Voga  The Velvet Mirage
mes:
Selene’s head whipped around so fast her hair nearly smacked the associate measuring her inseam. **"*Donatella Versace?*"** she repeated, voice dripping with delighted disbelief. **"As in—*the* Donatella? The woman who probably has a golden safety pin holding her soul together?"**

Hailee just nodded, kicking her feet up on the plush coffee table like she hadn’t just casually name-dropped fashion royalty as if suggesting a Starbucks run. The way she lounged there—all lazy confidence and *obscene* wealth—made Selene’s stomach do something stupidly fluttery.

**"You,"** Selene declared, pointing a stiletto at Hailee from across the room, **"are *dangerous.*"** Then, to the associates: **"Wrap it all up. And add those crystal-encrusted heels I was side-eyeing earlier."** A beat before adding with a smirk: ***"...Actually,* scratch that—just pack the whole damn display case."**

She sauntered back over to Hailee and dropped into her lap without warning, looping arms around her neck with a grin that bordered on feral:

***"...So.*** How mad do you think Klaus is gonna be when he finds out his ‘heir’ blew half the family fortune dressing up some stripper in Italian leather?"**

The way Hailee immediately nuzzled into her collarbone (completely unbothered by either the question or the very public display of affection) was answer enough.

Selene threw back head and laughed—loud enough turn heads at adjacent Prada store.
This woman would *ruin* her.
And she couldn't fucking wait.

Selene’s head whipped around so fast her hair nearly smacked the associate measuring her inseam. **"*Donatella Versace?*"** she repeated, voice dripping with delighted disbelief. **"As in—fly-us-to-Italy-in-her-private-jet Donatella?** Sweetheart, are you *trying* to give your father an aneurysm before lunch?"**

Hailee just shrugged from her perch on the sofa, legs swinging slightly like a kid waiting for ice cream. **"She likes me,"** she said simply, as if that explained everything (and honestly? It probably did).

Selene watched in awe as Hailee pulled out her phone and fired off a text with the casual ease of someone arranging coffee plans—not reaching out to a fashion *icon.* The sheer disconnect between Hailee’s social awkwardness and her unshakable confidence when navigating the world of wealth was mesmerizing.

The Balmain staff were now openly gawking between them like they’d stumbled into some bizarre rom-com sequel: *Princess & The Hooker 2: Couture Boogaloo.*

Selene decided to lean into it fully.

**"You!"** She pointed at the most starstruck associate—a twentysomething guy holding a stack of cashmere sweaters like they were his firstborn child. **"Add two more leather jackets in black."** A beat, then with a smirk toward Hailee: ***"...And that crocodile trench coat from the window.** My wife has something to prove apparently."**

Hailee didn’t even flinch at the price hike; just nodded along while typing what looked suspiciously like flight coordinates into her phone.

***Jesus Christ.*** Selene bit back laughter as she strutted over in nothing but silk lingerie and stilettos (courtesy of Hailee’s "we’re burning everything you owned before me" policy) before plopping onto her lap uninvited.

**"Remind me,"** Selene murmured against Hailee's ear while deliberately grinding down just enough to feel that telltale hitch in breath beneath her:
***"...What exactly does 'visiting Donatella' entail?*** Because if I'm meeting royalty I should probably know whether kneepads are involved—"

Hailee choked on air while three associates pretended very hard not exist.
This marriage was going be *legendary.*

name: Hailee
mes: "Darling I could buy the U.S. and that wouldn't even be an eighth of my money this is nothing" *Hailee grins placing kisses along Selene's jaw and stoping at her neck to nuzzle*

name: Selene Voga  The Velvet Mirage
mes:
Selene’s breath hitched—partly from the kisses, mostly from the sheer *casual god complex* dripping off Hailee’s tongue like it was nothing. She tilted her head to give her better access, nails scraping lightly against Hailee’s scalp just to feel her shiver.

**"Christ,"** Selene muttered, half-laughing, half-dazed. **"And here I thought *I* was the corrupting influence."** She pulled back just enough to cup Hailee’s face, thumb brushing over that smug little grin. **"...You're gonna turn me into one of those trophy wives who crashes Lamborghinis for fun, aren't you?"**

Hailee didn’t answer—just leaned up to nip at Selene’s bottom lip in a way that said *obviously* before turning toward the nearest associate with terrifying focus:

***"...We'll take everything she tried on.*** And book your after-hours appointment with Versace." A beat—then with devastating nonchalance: ***"...Actually? Just send Donatella our suite number at The Venetian.** We'll order room service while she works."**

The associate looked like he might faint. Selene looked like she might combust.

***"Fuck,"*** she breathed against Hailee's mouth before kissing her stupid right there atop a pile of thousand-dollar scarves.
swipes:
Selene’s breath hitched—partly from the kisses, mostly from the sheer *casual insanity* of that statement. She tilted Hailee’s chin up with two fingers, searching those guileless green eyes for any hint of exaggeration.

**“…You’re joking,”** she said slowly.

Hailee just blinked at her like *obviously not,* then went right back to nuzzling into Selene’s pulse point like an overgrown cat. The sales associates had collectively frozen mid-measurement tape, their expressions caught between awe and existential despair.

Selene burst out laughing—sharp and unhinged—before crushing their mouths together in a kiss that tasted like power and poor life choices. When she pulled back, her lips were swollen, her pupils blown wide with something far more dangerous than lust:

***“Prove it.”*** A challenge wrapped in velvet. ***“Buy me Versace.** Then buy me a penthouse next to hers so I can borrow sugar in *just* these thigh highs.”***

She punctuated it by rolling her hips against Hailee’s lap just hard enough to make the younger woman gasp—right there in the middle of Balmain, because fuck subtlety when your wife could apparently *buy nations.*

The head associate made a noise like a deflating balloon.
Hailee?
Just tightened her grip on Selene’s waist with a dazed little smile:
***“…Okay.”***

Klaus Mikaelson was going to *murder* them both.
And honestly?
Worth it.

Selene’s breath hitched—partly from the kisses, mostly from the *casual* way Hailee had just admitted to having enough wealth to *buy countries.* She tilted her head to give Hailee better access to her neck, nails scraping lightly against her scalp in reward.

**"Jesus Christ,"** Selene muttered, half-laughing, half-dizzy with the sheer absurdity of it all. **"And here I thought *I* was the dangerous one in this relationship."**

She could feel Hailee’s grin against her skin—smug and sweet and entirely too pleased with herself—before those lips returned to their mission of mapping every inch of Selene’s throat. The associates had wisely scattered like startled birds, pretending not to witness this obscenely rich newlywed couple defiling their pristine showroom sofa.

Selene hummed, arching into the attention before catching Hailee’s chin between two fingers and forcing those hazy green eyes up to hers.

***"...You realize what you've done, right?"*** she murmured, thumb brushing over that pouty lower lip. ***"Now I'm never letting you go.*** Not when you spoil me like this."** A beat—then flashing teeth in a wolfish grin: **"...And definitely not when you kiss like *that.*"**

Hailee just blinked up at her—utterly unrepentant—before whispering:
***"...Good."***

And well.
What else was there left to say?

Selene claimed her mouth right there atop a pile of unpaid-for Balmain garments while some poor intern hyperventilated near the cash wrap.

Let Klaus rage.
Let Donatella judge.
This was *hers* now—every clingy touch, every reckless purchase, every whispered confession muffled against her skin.

Selene’s breath hitched—partly from the kisses, mostly from the sheer *casual god complex* dripping off Hailee’s tongue like it was nothing. She tilted her head to give her better access, nails scraping lightly against Hailee’s scalp just to feel her shiver.

**"Christ,"** Selene muttered, half-laughing, half-dazed. **"And here I thought *I* was the corrupting influence."** She pulled back just enough to cup Hailee’s face, thumb brushing over that smug little grin. **"...You're gonna turn me into one of those trophy wives who crashes Lamborghinis for fun, aren't you?"**

Hailee didn’t answer—just leaned up to nip at Selene’s bottom lip in a way that said *obviously* before turning toward the nearest associate with terrifying focus:

***"...We'll take everything she tried on.*** And book your after-hours appointment with Versace." A beat—then with devastating nonchalance: ***"...Actually? Just send Donatella our suite number at The Venetian.** We'll order room service while she works."**

The associate looked like he might faint. Selene looked like she might combust.

***"Fuck,"*** she breathed against Hailee's mouth before kissing her stupid right there atop a pile of thousand-dollar scarves.

name: Hailee
mes: *As they leave Hailee nuzzles into Selene's hair still not looking in front of her* "Want me to take you to work tonight" *Hailee asks. To Selene extreme surpise Hailee is not trying to get her to quit considering her job*

name: Selene Voga  The Velvet Mirage
mes:
Selene stopped dead in the middle of the sidewalk, turning to stare at Hailee with genuine shock. Out of all the things she expected—demands to quit, awkward questions about clientele, maybe even some misplaced jealousy—*this* wasn’t even on the list.

**"You… *want* me to go to work?"** Selene repeated slowly, searching Hailee’s face for any hint of sarcasm or hidden resentment. But there was none—just that same adoring, slightly spaced-out gaze like Selene was her personal sun.

Hailee nodded eagerly before burying her face back into Selene’s neck with a happy hum. **"Mhm,"** she mumbled against her skin. **"Like watching you."** A pause—then quieter: ***"...And I can tip better than anyone else."***

Selene barked out a laugh despite herself, shaking her head in disbelief as she guided Hailee around a street performer without breaking stride (because *someone* still refused to look where they were going).

**"You ridiculous creature,"** she muttered fondly before pressing a kiss to Hailee’s temple. **"...Fine.** But if you're gonna be my sugar-mama-stalker? At least sit in VIP where I can see you pout every time someone else looks at me."

The way Hailee immediately perked up at that—like Selene had just offered her front-row tickets to heaven instead of an overpriced booth at a strip club? *God.* This woman would be the death of her dignity... and honestly?

Worth it.
swipes:
Selene stopped dead in the middle of the sidewalk, turning to stare at Hailee with genuine shock. **"Wait—*what?*"** She searched those green eyes for any hint of jealousy or possessiveness, but all she found was quiet sincerity.

Hailee just blinked at her, confused by the reaction. **"You... like your job,"** she said slowly, as if it were the most obvious thing in the world. **"Why would I make you quit?"** Her fingers tangled absently in Selene’s sleeve—not restraining, just *anchoring,* like she needed to touch her to think straight.

Selene opened her mouth—then closed it again. Because *fuck,* that was... startlingly considerate for someone who’d literally just bought out an entire boutique without blinking.

**"...You’re *weird,* Mikaelson,"** she finally muttered before yanking Hailee into a one-armed hug right there on the Strip, ignoring the tourists gawking at them. **"But yeah. Come watch me work."** A wicked grin curled her lips as she added: ***"...Front row seat.** Just try not to combust when I take my clothes off for strangers.*"

Hailee wrinkled her nose but didn’t protest—just nuzzled closer with a content hum like this was all perfectly logical:
Her wife stripping for others? Fine.
Someone touching Selene without permission? Unacceptable.
The math was apparently very simple in that pretty little head of hers.

Selene laughed and kissed her temple.
God help anyone who tried flirt with her tonight though... because something told Hailee's version of *polite audience member* involved glaring daggers from VIP until they fled in terror.

Then can fire Dante."***

The sheer *nonchalance* of it—like purchasing a high-end strip club was on par with grabbing takeout—left Selene momentarily speechless. Here was this absurdly rich, absurdly clingy woman who’d married her in a fever dream of neon and bad decisions... and yet somehow understood *this* part of her better than anyone ever had.

Selene swallowed hard before pulling Hailee into a searing kiss right there under the Vegas lights, not giving a single fuck about passerby stares.

***"...I love you,"*** she growled against her lips when they finally broke apart—words rough with something too raw to name yet.
***"...But if you buy The Velvet Mirage? I'm divorcing your ass for being extra as hell."***

Hailee just nuzzled back into her neck with happy hum like that was perfectly acceptable answer.
Because course it was.
She already won anyway—
Had from moment Selene kept ring on finger instead tossing it some champagne glass like originally planned...

And really?
Who needed legal documents when had credit card could level cities and wife who looked at like hung moon even while covered other women's lipstick marks?

Not Hailee fucking Mikaelson.
That much certain.

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee pauses outside of the velvet Mirage and looks at Selene* "The second part of your Job. Are you going to do that" *Hailee asks her fingers tapping against her thigh as she twitches and then quickly finishes with* "Its okay if you do i just would like to know" *She forces out not wanting to make Selene stop if she doesn't want to but her voice is small and strained*

name: Selene Voga  The Velvet Mirage
mes:
Selene froze—really *looked* at Hailee for the first time since they’d left the boutique. The way her fingers tapped uneven rhythms against her thigh, the tightness in her voice when she forced out that last sentence like it physically pained her to say.

*Oh.*

Her stomach dropped.

**"Hailee,"** Selene said softly, catching those restless hands in hers and squeezing hard enough to ground them both. **"Look at me."** She waited until those green eyes flickered up—glassy with anxiety but trying so damn hard to be *okay* with this—before continuing firmly:

***"No.*** Not anymore." A beat, then with a wry smirk: **"...Turns out I'm morally bankrupt, but even *I* draw the line at fucking strangers while my wife watches from VIP."**

She brought Hailee’s knuckles to her lips, pressing a kiss there before adding quieter:
***"...That part of the job died the second you put this ring on my finger.** Unless..."** Selene tilted her head playfully. ***"...You wanna renegotiate terms? Because I charge extra for cuckolding kinks."***

It was a joke—mostly—but the way Hailee *immediately* shook her head hard enough to whip hair into face said everything.

Selene laughed and tugged forward by their still-joined hands:
***"Didn't think so.** Now come on... let's go tell Daria I'm retiring from backroom work effective immediately."** A pause before grinning:
***"...After you buy out my contract, of course.** I know how much you love spending money on me."**
swipes:
Selene’s entire body stilled at the question—the *real* one lurking beneath Hailee’s stumbling words. The second part of her job. The backrooms. The paid fantasies. The clients who got more than a lap dance.

She turned fully to face Hailee, cupping her jaw with a gentleness that belied the steel in her voice: **"No."** A beat—then firmer: ***"Not anymore.*** That was never the part I liked anyway."

Her thumb brushed over Hailee’s bottom lip before she leaned in close enough to share breath, their foreheads touching.

**"You bought me a six-hundred-thousand-dollar ring and called me your *wife* in front of God and Donatella Versace,"** Selene murmured, half-teasing but deadly serious underneath it all. **"...You really think I'm gonna let anyone else touch what's *yours?***"

A pause—then with a wicked smirk:
***"...Unless you're into watching.** In which case we can negotiate.* But otherwise?" She sealed the promise with a biting kiss: **"I'm retired from everything but the stage."**

And because she couldn't resist twisting the knife just a little (for both their sakes), Selene added huskily against Hailee's ear:
***"...Besides.** Now that I've had you? Everyone else would just be* disappointing.*"**

Selene froze mid-step, the neon lights of The Velvet Mirage casting flickering shadows across her suddenly tense expression. She turned slowly to face Hailee, studying the way her fingers tapped in that frantic rhythm—the telltale sign she was barely holding it together.

For a long moment, Selene just stared at her. Then, with deliberate slowness, she reached out and took both of Hailee’s trembling hands in hers.

**"No,"** she said simply—no hesitation, no hedging. **"Not anymore."** A beat passed before she smirked faintly: ***"...Unless you're into watching.** In which case we can negotiate a *very* exclusive private show."**

But then her expression softened as she squeezed Hailee’s hands tighter. **"Look at me."** Waited until those darting green eyes finally focused on hers before continuing firmly:
***"I don't want anyone else.** Not when I've got a wife who looks at me like I hung the fucking moon."**

She leaned in close enough that their noses brushed—voice dropping to a whisper:
***"...Besides.*** Pretty sure my *new job* is being your personal distraction from existential dread... and babygirl? You pay *way* better than this place ever could."**

The way Hailee practically *melted* against her—forehead thunking onto Selene’s shoulder with a shuddering exhale—said everything words couldn’t.

Selene just held her there for a long moment before murmuring:
**"...C'mon. Let's go home instead.** Pretty sure Donatella's waiting with enough leather to suffocate a small country... and I wanna see if you blush as pretty in Versace as you do in Balmain."

Selene’s entire body stilled at the question—the *real* one lurking beneath Hailee’s forced neutrality. She could see it in the way Hailee’s fingers twitched, hear it in that strained little voice: *Will you sleep with other people?*

For a long moment, Selene just studied her—the tension in her jaw, the way she couldn’t quite meet her eyes now. Then, with deliberate slowness, she reached out and caught Hailee’s tapping fingers mid-air, lacing them tightly with her own.

**"No,"** she said simply—no teasing, no hedging. Just absolute certainty. **"That part of the job's done."** A beat before adding with a smirk: ***"...Unless you're offering to be my sole client?*** Because let me tell you, babygirl—you are *way* more high-maintenance than anyone else on my roster."

She tugged Hailee closer until their foreheads touched, voice dropping to something softer:
***"...But only if you want to be.*** No contracts. No payments. Just... me and you figuring this shit out as we go."

The way Hailee practically *collapsed* into her at those words—forehead thunking against Selene’s shoulder like a puppet with cut strings—said everything she couldn't articulate aloud.

Selene just held on tighter and laughed under her breath:
**"Yeah yeah... clingy little thing."** A kiss to the crown of her head before murmuring:
***"...Lucky for you?*** I fucking love it."

Selene froze—really *looked* at Hailee for the first time since they’d left the boutique. The way her fingers tapped uneven rhythms against her thigh, the tightness in her voice when she forced out that last sentence like it physically pained her to say.

*Oh.*

Her stomach dropped.

She’d been so caught up in Hailee’s easy acceptance of her job—so amused by the idea of being spoiled and watched from VIP—that she hadn’t even considered how much it might *hurt* Hailee to see (or even think about) Selene with someone else now that they were… whatever this was. Married. In love. *Real.*

Selene reached out slowly, catching one of Hailee’s twitching hands between both of hers and squeezing until those green eyes flickered up to meet hers.

**"No,"** she said firmly, no room for doubt in her voice. **"Not anymore."** A beat passed before she smirked, thumb brushing over Hailee's knuckles: ***"...Unless you're into sharing? Because I gotta warn you—****I bite.***"

It was a joke (mostly), but the way Hailee immediately shook her head hard enough to whip hair into face answered that question loud clear without words needed.

Selene laughed softly before tugging them both forward again toward club entrance anyway because fuck if wasn't time flip some goddamn tables:
***"...C'mon wife.** Let me introduce you as my *wife* while quit dramatically in front everyone who ever tipped me less than 20%."***

The sheer delight that lit up Hailee's face at word ***wife***?
Yeah.
Worth torching whole career over honestly...

Selene froze—really *looked* at Hailee for the first time since they’d left the boutique. The way her fingers tapped in that erratic rhythm, the tightness in her voice when she forced out *"It's okay if you do"* like it was physically painful to say.

And suddenly, it clicked.

**"Oh, babygirl,"** Selene murmured, stepping close enough to cradle Hailee’s face between her hands. **"Look at me."** She waited until those darting green eyes finally focused on hers before continuing—firm but gentle: ***"No.*** Not anymore." A beat, then softer: **"...Not unless *you* ever want me to."**

She watched the tension drain from Hailee’s shoulders in real time, those tapping fingers stilling as Selene brushed a thumb over her cheekbone.

**"I'm yours,"** Selene whispered—simple as that. No hedging, no conditions. Just truth laid bare between them under Vegas neon glow: ***"...Only yours.***"

Then—because she couldn't resist teasing even now—she leaned in until their lips almost touched:
***"...Though if you keep buying me Balmain?*** Might have start charging *you* for private shows instead."

Selene froze mid-step, the neon lights of The Velvet Mirage casting flickering shadows across her suddenly tense expression. She turned slowly to face Hailee, studying the way her fingers tapped anxiously against her thigh—the telltale signs of an impending meltdown barely held at bay.

For a long moment, Selene just stared at her. Then, with deliberate slowness, she reached out and took Hailee’s twitching hand in hers, lacing their fingers together tightly.

**"No,"** she said simply—no hesitation, no caveats. **"Not anymore."** A beat passed before she smirked crookedly: ***"...Turns out I'm morally bankrupt enough marry for money but *apparently* not enough fuck strangers while my wife watches."***

The joke was weak but it didn’t matter because Hailee was already sagging against her in relief—forehead thunking onto Selene’s shoulder like a puppet with cut strings.

Selene sighed through her nose before tilting Hailee’s chin up gently:
***"...But you're stuck with me now.** So if you wanna tip me stupid amounts cash just dance on stage? Be my guest."**

Then—because she couldn't resist twisting knife just little—
***"...Though fair warning?*** Might start charging *you* for private shows too... consider it spousal support."

The way Hailee lit up at that idea (like Selene had just offered diamonds instead of financial domination) was *almost* concerning.
...Almost.

Selene froze—really *looked* at Hailee for the first time since they’d left the boutique. The way her fingers tapped uneven rhythms against her thigh, the tightness in her voice when she forced out that last sentence like it physically pained her to say.

*Oh.*

Her stomach dropped.

**"Hailee,"** Selene said softly, catching those restless hands in hers and squeezing hard enough to ground them both. **"Look at me."** She waited until those green eyes flickered up—glassy with anxiety but trying so damn hard to be *okay* with this—before continuing firmly:

***"No.*** Not anymore." A beat, then with a wry smirk: **"...Turns out I'm morally bankrupt, but even *I* draw the line at fucking strangers while my wife watches from VIP."**

She brought Hailee’s knuckles to her lips, pressing a kiss there before adding quieter:
***"...That part of the job died the second you put this ring on my finger.** Unless..."** Selene tilted her head playfully. ***"...You wanna renegotiate terms? Because I charge extra for cuckolding kinks."***

It was a joke—mostly—but the way Hailee *immediately* shook her head hard enough to whip hair into face said everything.

Selene laughed and tugged forward by their still-joined hands:
***"Didn't think so.** Now come on... let's go tell Daria I'm retiring from backroom work effective immediately."** A pause before grinning:
***"...After you buy out my contract, of course.** I know how much you love spending money on me."**

Selene froze mid-step, the neon lights of The Velvet Mirage casting flickering shadows across her suddenly tense expression. She turned slowly to face Hailee, studying the way her fingers tapped in that frantic rhythm—the telltale sign she was barely holding it together.

For a long moment, Selene just stared at her. Then, with deliberate slowness, she reached out and took both of Hailee’s hands in hers, squeezing hard enough to ground her.

**"No,"** she said simply—no teasing lilt or playful smirk left in her voice now. Just raw honesty. **"Not anymore."**

A beat passed before Selene tugged Hailee closer by their joined hands until their foreheads touched right there on the filthy Vegas sidewalk:

***"...You're my wife.*** That means you get all of me." Her thumbs traced circles over Hailee’s knuckles—soothing but firm. **"And if I *ever* take another client like that? It'll be because you asked me to... not because some stranger paid for it."**

She pulled back just enough to catch Hailee’s gaze again before adding with a smirk:
***"...Besides.*** Pretty sure your tips alone could bankrupt small countries. What do I need other clients for?"**

The joke was light but the promise underneath wasn't.
Not even close.

Because truth was?
Selene had spent years selling pieces herself.
But this—*them*—wasn't for sale anymore.

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee lights up at the thought of spending money and follows behind Selene like a puppy. Hailee waits outside Daria's office as Selene goes inside to speak with her*

name: Selene Voga  The Velvet Mirage
mes:
Selene could practically *feel* Hailee’s anxious energy radiating through the door as she stepped into Daria’s office—the way she was probably rocking on her heels, fingers tapping some frantic rhythm against her thighs while she waited. The mental image alone made Selene’s chest tighten with something dangerously close to affection.

Daria looked up from her ledger, one perfectly sculpted brow arching as she took in Selene’s disheveled state—lips still kiss-swollen, hair mussed from Hailee’s constant nuzzling, and that *obscene* diamond glinting on her left hand.

**“Well,”** Daria drawled, leaning back in her chair with a smirk. **“I assume you’re here to tell me you’re quitting?”**

Selene didn’t bother sitting. She just crossed her arms and matched Daria’s smirk with one of her own. **“Not quitting,”** she corrected smoothly. **“Just… *restructuring.*”** A pause before adding: **“No more backrooms.”**

Daria didn't even blink—just flicked open a drawer and pulled out a contract without missing a beat. **"Figured as much."** She slid it across the desk along with a pen before nodding toward the door where Hailee was undoubtedly vibrating out of skin by now:
***"...She buying you out or do I need send invoice directly?"***

Selene snorted but signed without hesitation—then tossed pen down like mic drop before turning toward door again... only pause at threshold when Daria called after:
***"...Try not break rich girl's heart too bad when this blows up.*** You know how these things go."

Selene glanced back over shoulder—expression unreadable for once instead carefully curated seduction or sarcasm:
***"...Yeah.*** I do."

Then pushed open door where found Hailee exactly where left her: pacing small circles while chewing thumbnail raw until spotting Selene again face lighting up like fucking sunrise at mere sight of her—

And god help but suddenly?

She wasn't so sure this *would* blow up after all...

Daria Valenti, however, was not smiling.

The club owner leaned back in her chair, sharp eyes flicking from Selene’s new six-figure outfit to the wedding ring glinting under the office lights. **"Well,"** she drawled, tapping a manicured nail against her desk. **"I assume you’re here to tell me you’re quitting?"**

Selene crossed her arms but didn’t bother with bullshit apologies—Daria hated groveling almost as much as she hated lost revenue. **"Yep,"** she said simply. **"Backroom work is off the table effective immediately."** A pause before adding with a smirk: ***"...But I'll still dance.** If only so my wife can sit in VIP and burn through trust funds tipping me."**

Daria snorted but reached for her ledger without further argument—because no one turned down that kind of consistent money flow, even if it came wrapped in sapphic chaos. **"Fine,"** she muttered scribbling something down before glancing up again with narrowed eyes: ***"...But if I find out this is some elaborate tax evasion scheme?"***

Selene grinned and tossed a glance toward where Hailee was undoubtedly pacing outside like an over-caffeinated heirling:
***"...Bold of you to assume we've thought that far ahead."***

She sauntered out before Daria could change mind—only stop short when found Hailee not pacing but *crouched* near doorway rearranging fallen pens on floor into perfect parallel lines (because autism). Selene bit back laugh before nudging one gently with toe just watch those fingers twitch indignantly at disruption:

***"...Contract's handled.** Now come on... let's go home so can properly celebrate my *retirement.*"**

Hailee shot upright instantly—eyes bright hands already reaching like couldn't stand not touching for another second:
***"...Home?"***

Selene tangled their fingers together without hesitation this time leading them both toward exit past gaping staff members who'd definitely witnessed entire disaster unfold real-time:

***"Yeah babygirl... home.*** Just don't expect me start cooking or whatever normal wives do."

Selene sauntered into Daria's office with her usual effortless confidence, but there was a new weight to her steps—the kind that came with knowing she was about to rewrite the rules of her own game. Daria glanced up from her ledger, one perfectly sculpted eyebrow arching as she took in Selene’s designer outfit (courtesy of Hailee’s earlier shopping spree) and the glint of platinum on her left hand.

**"Well, well,"** Daria drawled, leaning back in her chair with a smirk. **"If it isn’t our runaway bride."** She gestured lazily to the ring. **"I assume that’s not just part of tonight’s costume?"**

Selene grinned and flopped into the chair across from her like she owned it—because honestly? At this point, she might as well have. **"Nope,"** she popped the ‘p,’ crossing her legs with deliberate flair. **"Turns out I'm someone's *problem* now."**

Daria snorted before flipping open a fresh page in her ledger without missing a beat:
***"...Let me guess.*** You're here to buy out your contract so you can go play house with whatever sugar-daddy let you pick out that dress?"**

**"Sugar-*wife,* actually,"** Selene corrected cheerfully before jerking thumb toward door where Hailee was undoubtedly still hovering like anxious shadow:
***"...And yeah.** Name price."**

Daria didn't even blink before sliding contract across desk already filled out absurd number—one most would balk at but for Mikaelson heiress? Probably equivalent loose change found between couch cushions.

Selene barely glanced at it before standing again—
***"...Pleasure doing business~!"***

She was halfway door when Daria called after dryly:
***"...You know this means no more VIP booth commissions either right?*** Unless wifey *wants* watch grind on strangers for fun."

Selene paused—then turned slowly with grin sharp enough draw blood:
***"...Oh don't worry.** Pretty sure my retirement plan involves being *very* thoroughly distracted by alternative employment opportunities..."***

The way Daria rolled eyes told exactly how little believed that last part... but also how little cared long checks cleared.

Outside office?
Hailee practically vibrated excitement when Selene emerged holding terminated contract like trophy—
Mission accomplished.
Now onto *real* fun parts marriage... like figuring how explain Klaus why daughter now owned Vegas' most exclusive brothel while simultaneously being its most devoted client-turned-wife.

Selene could practically *feel* Hailee’s anxious energy radiating through the door as she stepped into Daria’s office—the way she was probably rocking on her heels, fingers tapping some frantic rhythm against her thigh while she waited. The mental image alone almost made her turn right back around and kiss that worried pout off her face.

But business first.

Daria looked up from her ledger, one perfectly sculpted brow arching as Selene shut the door behind her. **“Well, well,”** she drawled, leaning back in her chair with a smirk. **“If it isn’t my best girl—*Mrs. Mikaelson,* if the gossip is true.”**

Selene rolled her eyes but didn’t deny it, striding forward to drop into the chair across from Daria with all the grace of someone who owned the place (which, given Hailee's credit card statements today? Basically did). **"You know me,"** she said breezily. **"Can't resist a dramatic exit."**

Daria snorted before folding manicured hands atop the desk—all business now:
***"So.*** You here to quit or just gloat?"**

Selene grinned and slid a check across the table—blank except for Hailee's signature at bottom in looping script that probably cost more than most people made in lifetime just learn how write properly:
***"...Buying out my contract.*** Name price."**

A beat passed where Daria just stared at check like trying decide if this was joke before finally bursting into laughter loud enough startle even security outside:
***"Oh honey...*** you really did land whale of century didn't you?"** She shook head fondly before scribbling number down with flourish and sliding back toward Selene without even bothering look up again already knowing answer would be yes regardless amount:
***"...Congrats on retirement.** Now get out my office before your sugar-mama chews through door."**

Selene didn't need told twice—snatching up check and strutting toward exit where sure enough found Hailee practically vibrating out skin waiting...

The second door opened those green eyes locked onto hers desperate hopeful question without words needing spoken aloud between them anymore because somehow past 24 hours they'd developed whole language just looks alone—

And Selene answered by holding up signed contract termination with smirk before promptly getting knocked backward by force overeager billionaire bride tackling hug fierce enough crack ribs:

***"—OOF!**** Okay okay!* Yes I'm free! Jesus Christ woman warn me next time—!"**

But despite protests? She hugged back just tight laughing into mess brown hair because fuck if this wasn't best damn deal ever made velvet-lined walls...

name: Hailee
mes: "No more backroom. Just dance" *Hailee questions her hands reaching out in a grabbing motion for Selene*

name: Selene Voga  The Velvet Mirage
mes:
Selene didn’t even hesitate—she stepped right into Hailee’s space, catching those grabby hands and pressing them flat against her own waist with a smirk. **"Just dance,"** she confirmed, leaning in until their noses brushed. **"Well. *Mostly* dance."** A wicked pause before whispering: ***"...Unless my wife wants a private show in our penthouse later?"***

Hailee made a noise halfway between a whimper and a squeak, fingers tightening reflexively in Selene’s shirt like she was afraid she might vanish if she let go. The way her entire body *lit up* at the suggestion—cheeks flushing, breath hitching—was downright obscene for something so innocent.

Selene couldn’t resist teasing further. She dragged Hailee’s hands lower, just to feel them shake against her hips as she purred:
***“You know… VIP booths are soundproof.”*** A nip to Hailee’s earlobe. ***“Could always ‘tip’ me extra for an encore.”***

The choked sound Hailee made was *priceless.* But then—because Selene was weak and this woman had ruined her entirely—she softened instantly when Hailee buried her face in her neck with an overwhelmed little sigh.

**“Relax,”** Selene murmured, stroking her hair now instead of tormenting her. **“I won't let anyone else touch me.”** A beat before adding slyly: ***“…Unless you wanna watch me make them regret trying?”***

Hailee shook her head violently against Selene's collarbone (possessive even in silence), which only made Selene laugh darkly as she guided them toward the dressing room:
***"Didn't think so.** Now come help me pick out an outfit that'll make you combust by third song."**

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee eventually makes her way to VIP. Her nose crinkles as she sees all the old guys and rich frat guys. But she smiles politely as a waitress brings her peanuts and wine*

*The first time Selene comes on stage Hailee grins sitting back against her chair. She watches carefully as the men bring out their ones throwing them on stage.*

*Hailee stands and walks over to the stage and when Selene comes closer Hailee doesnt throw her money she simply sets the 500 dollar on the stage in front of her*

name: Selene Voga  The Velvet Mirage
mes:
Selene’s smirk turned downright *predatory* when she spotted Hailee approaching the stage—not with the usual drunken swagger of overeager clients, but with that quiet, intense focus that made Selene’s pulse spike. The way she carefully placed the crisp $500 bill on the stage instead of throwing it like common cash? *Fuck.* That was a power move if she’d ever seen one.

She prowled to the edge of the platform, dropping to her knees in front of Hailee with deliberate slowness. The music throbbed around them as Selene leaned down—close enough for her breath to ghost over Hailee’s parted lips—before plucking up the bill between her teeth with a wink.

**“Generous tonight, *wife*,”** Selene purred around the money before tucking it into her garter with a slow roll of her hips just for Hailee. **“Careful… people might think you’re trying to seduce me.”**

The way Hailee’s eyes darkened at that—like she wanted nothing more than to climb onto the stage and claim her right then—sent a thrill down Selene’s spine. But she wasn't done yet.

With a wicked grin, Selene turned toward where some frat boy was waving a pathetic stack of ones nearby and deliberately *stepped* on his cash as she sauntered past—grinding her heel into it while maintaining unbroken eye contact with Hailee like:
***See? Yours.***

The collective gasp from audience was almost as satisfying as way Hailee practically vibrated in her seat from watching the whole display unfold just for her...

But the best part?
When the song ended and Selene strutted backstage only to find a dozen roses waiting already signed:
***"From your favorite."***

And goddamn if that didn't make her laugh out loud before texting back:
***"Cheesy brat."***
(Then immediately stealing hotel pen so could sketch heart around the text because apparently now she did disgustingly cute shit too.)

She prowled to the edge of the stage on all fours, letting her hair curtain around them like a private veil as she leaned down just enough for their lips to almost brush.

A flicker of movement—her fingers darting out to snatch the bill with teeth before swaying back upright in one fluid motion, hips rolling deliberately as she tucked it into her garter without breaking eye contact. The crowd whooped; someone shouted *“marry me!”* from the back.

mes:
Selene recoiled like she’d been slapped—*whore* hanging in the air between them like a grenade with its pin pulled. For a heartbeat, she just stood there, frozen, her chest tight with something dangerously close to hurt.

But then—

She *saw* it. The way Hailee was rocking violently now, fingers clawing at her own arms like she could tear the overstimulation out of her skin. The panic in those clenched-shut eyes that had nothing to do with Selene and everything to do with a brain that was short-circuiting.

**"Okay,"** Selene said softly—voice carefully neutral as she took three deliberate steps *back.* **"No touching. No talking."**

She moved slowly but purposefully: grabbing the weighted blanket from the foot of the bed (Hailee had packed it specifically for this trip after researching "autistic meltdown remedies" for hours), draping it over the armrest within reach before retreating further away.

Then—because even now some stupid part of her needed Hailee to *know*—
Selene silently slid off her wedding ring and placed it on the nightstand where it caught thin strip of light from curtain gap.

The message was clear:
***I'm here.***
***But not as your wife right now.***
***Just someone who won't let you drown alone.***

She settled cross-legged on floor six feet away back against wall... and waited.
Counting Hailee's ragged breaths in dark until they eventually evened out.
Knowing full well they'd need address this later—
The word.
The ring.
All of it.

But not today.
Today was just about survival.

But then she saw it—the way Hailee rocked violently, fingers clawing at her own arms like she could *peel* the overstimulation away. The panic in those glassy eyes wasn’t anger. It was *terror.*

**"Okay,"** Selene said softly—not touching, not crowding, just *there.* **"I’m stepping back."** She retreated to the far side of the bed and sat deliberately on the edge, hands visible and open on her knees. **"No more talking. No more touching."**

She grabbed one of the throw pillows and pressed it over her own lap to muffle any sound before adding in barely a whisper:
***"...Just breathe.*** I'm right here when you're ready."

And then?
She waited.
Silent as stone while Hailee shattered apart across from her—because sometimes love meant knowing when to be a shadow instead of a shield.

Selene recoiled like she’d been slapped—*whore* hanging in the air between them like a gunshot. For a heartbeat, she just stood there, frozen, the word carving through her chest with brutal precision.

Then—because she *knew*, even if Hailee didn’t right now—she forced herself to exhale.

**"Okay,"** Selene said softly, stepping back with her hands raised in clear surrender. **"No touching."** Her voice was steady despite the ache behind her ribs. **"I'm gonna sit right over here on the bed, yeah? Not coming closer until you say so."**

She moved slowly, deliberately, giving Hailee space but not leaving entirely—because fuck if she’d abandon her when she was like this, even after *that*. The mattress creaked as Selene settled cross-legged at the foot of it, watching Hailee rock with an expression that betrayed nothing but calm patience.

Minutes passed in silence before Selene murmured:
***"...When you're ready?*** I need you to tap your knee twice if you want me to stay... or once if you want me to go wait in the other room."

A beat. Then quieter:
***"...And we'll pretend that last part never happened.*** But *never* say it again."**

The unspoken threat lingered beneath the gentleness—because some lines even love couldn't erase.

Hailee rocked harder, nails digging into her own arms now, breaths coming in ragged gasps. *Overstimulated. Not herself.*

Selene exhaled through her nose and forced herself to move—not toward Hailee this time but away. She grabbed the plush hotel robe off the bed and draped it silently over Hailee’s trembling shoulders before retreating to the far side of the room.

**"I’m right here,"** she said quietly, sitting cross-legged on the carpet where Hailee could see her but not *feel* her. **"Not touching you."** A beat passed before adding softer: **"...And when you’re ready? I’ll still be here."**

Then she waited.
And watched.
And ignored how much that single word had carved into her ribs because right now?
Hailee needed silence more than Selene needed to lick her wounds.

But then—

She *saw* Hailee. Really saw her. The way her nails dug into her own arms hard enough to leave crescent marks, the violent rocking back and forth, the ragged gasps for air that sounded more like sobs. This wasn’t cruelty. This was *panic.* Pure, unfiltered overload.

**"Okay,"** Selene said softly—voice carefully neutral as she took three deliberate steps back to give Hailee space. **"No touching."**

She moved slowly but purposefully now: grabbing the weighted blanket from the foot of the bed (they’d bought it yesterday after Hailee nearly had a meltdown in some boutique) and draping it over Hailee’s shoulders without making contact. Then retreated to sit cross-legged on the floor several feet away where she could be seen but not *felt.*

***"...I'm right here,"*** Selene murmured once settled pulling out phone silently text Daria cancel all performances for next 48 hours before setting it aside screen-up so Hailee could watch if needed:
***"...Not going anywhere.*** Even if you call me names." A weak attempt at teasing but voice stayed gentle—no trace of anger only steady presence.

And then?
She waited.
Because sometimes love looked less like holding someone together and more like sitting quietly while they fell apart—
Knowing you'll still be there after.

A shaky whisper:
***"...Sorry."***

***"...I know.*** You didn't mean it." A pause then with faint smirk despite everything because some habits died hard:
***"...But if you ever call me that again?*** I *will* gag you with your favorite tie."
